para: Each ℑ in a µ has associated with it a buffer of modified versions of the ℑ. When the ℑ is modified, the new version is stored in the buffer. The Undo command restores the next oldest version from the buffer, thereby undoing the most recent change. The changed version is not destroyed, and can be recovered with .
The ℑ buffer has a limited size. When it is full, the oldest versions of an ℑ will be lost when new modifications are made. The size of the buffer can be changed with .
